intro: Haloragis yarrabensis, commonly known as the Yarrabent starburry, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of South Australia. It belongs to the family Haloragaceae and is characterized by its prostrate growth habit and small, star-shaped flowers. The plant typically blooms in spring, producing clusters of yellow or white flowers that attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies. It is adapted to survive in harsh, dry environments, with succulent leaves that store water. Haloragis yarrabensis is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and ecological significance in its native habitat.
